question: Symptoms
data: COVID-19 causes flu-like symptoms, typically starting with a fever ğŸ¤’, followed by a dry cough .
It rarely seems to cause a runny nose ğŸ‘ƒ, sneezing ğŸ¤§, or sore throat. Those symptoms are more likely signs of a cold.
In some patients - particularly the elderly and others with other chronic health conditions, it can develop into pneumonia, with chest tightness, chest pain, and shortness of breath.

question: Protecting Yourself
data: The best way to protect yourself from COVID-19 is to reduce personal contact. Here are some simple tips

âœ… Make a habit of frequently washing your hands ğŸ¤² with soap ğŸ§¼ and water ğŸ’§ or an alcohol-based hand wash. DO THIS: after visiting the bathroom ğŸš½, after travelling on public transport ğŸš‚, and before eating ğŸ½
âœ… Reduce personal contact - e.g. avoid shaking ğŸ¤ hands and keep at least 1ï¸âƒ£-2ï¸âƒ£ metres away from other people and avoid crowded places.
âœ… Cover your mouth ğŸ‘„ and nose ğŸ‘ƒ with a tissue or your sleeve (not your hands) when you cough or sneeze ğŸ¤§
âœ… Consider getting a flu jag ğŸ’‰, to avoid the possibility of acquiring both COVID-19 and flu at the same time.
âŒ Avoid touching your eyes ğŸ‘, nose ğŸ‘ƒ or mouth ğŸ‘„ with your hands.
âŒ Try to avoid crowded places where it's difficult to stay over 1 metre from others.
